meanings.sent1: The two parties decided to renegotiate the contract for better terms.
meanings.sent2: After some disagreements, they finally renegotiated the deal.
meanings.sent3: The friends had to renegotiate their plans after the unexpected rainstorm.
meanings.sent4: She renegotiated her approach to studying after realizing she needed a new strategy.
meanings.sent5: The coach renegotiated the team's game plan to secure a victory.

meanings.sent1: They sat down to renegotiate the rental agreement for the apartment.
meanings.sent2: The union and management had to renegotiate the workers' salaries.
meanings.sent3: The siblings had to renegotiate the rules of their game to make it fair for everyone.
meanings.sent4: The countries decided to renegotiate their trade deal for mutual benefit.
meanings.sent5: The students had to renegotiate the group project timeline to meet the deadline.

meanings.sent1: The company had to renegotiate their partnership agreement due to changing circumstances.
meanings.sent2: They decided to renegotiate the terms of their friendship after a misunderstanding.
meanings.sent3: The family had to renegotiate their vacation plans when their flight got canceled.
meanings.sent4: She had to renegotiate her decision to quit her job after receiving a promotion.
meanings.sent5: The team captain had to renegotiate the team's strategy after a series of losses.
